The negative reception to Gigli led to Sony Pictures removing the film's advertising and replacing it with advertisements for another release.

node_2: most expensive box office flops of all time
edge: Gigli's worldwide gross of $7.7 million against a $75.6 million budget made it one of the most expensive box office flops of all time.
Gigli was panned by critics as stated in the context.
Gigli stars Bradley Cooper and Jennifer Lopez lacked chemistry as mentioned in the context.

node_2: losing $42 million in the quarter of its release
edge: As stated in the context, Sony Pictures lost $42 million in the quarter of its release.
Amy Dawes of Variety found the story to be ludicrous and predicted that the film would tank, but overall she enjoyed it and referred to it as a fun film.
Joel Siegel of Good Morning America gave the film a 'D' rating and stated that, unlike other historic failures, Gigli only wanted to be a romantic comedy and did not have any measure of pretension.

Gleiberman from Entertainment Weekly gave the film a 'C+' rating and stated that Gigli was a watchable bad movie, but it was far from your typical cookie-cutter blockbuster. There were no shoot-outs or car chases, and there wasn't much romantic suspense, either.
Roger Ebert's colleague Berardinelli gave the film two stars and stated that, compared to other bad movies, Jen & Ben offered less pain because of Lopez and Affleck's appealing performances.

Has a critics' rating of D- according to Yahoo! Movies.
Was the subject of an article in satirical newspaper, The Onion, titled 'Gigli focus groups demand new ending in which Affleck and Lopez die.'
Was lampooned by late-night talk show hosts in their monologues.
Notes that 'in the 21st century, the mixed review has become an endangered species'
Bailey also notes that 'most readers look for the Rotten Tomatoes rating and pull-quote, and little beyond that.'
Was compared to a bad baseball team, The Mets, by Conan O'Brien.
Said 'The Mets are doing so badly that they will be renamed 'The New York Gigli.'
in this movie, Affleck is portrayed as a member of the filming crew parodying his role in Argo
